Container.Name: owncloud-infinite-scale
Container.Overview:
ownCloud Infinite Scale (oCIS) is the new file sync & share platform that will be the foundation of your data management platform. https://github.com/owncloud/ocis
====!IMPORTANT!==== BEFORE you setup this template and create the container, there are some initial steps you need to take. Please look at the readme for instructions (click Support>Read Me First)

Config.Name: Appdata / config
Config.Description: For configuration files. If this will be mapped to a cache device on your host, use /mnt/cache/ instead of /mnt/user (for performance reasons).

Config.Name: Data
Config.Description: For data. For configuration files. If this will be mapped to a cache device on your host, use /mnt/cache/ instead of /mnt/user (for performance reasons).

Config.Name: Self-Signed cert
Config.Description: Determines whether owncloud should use an auto-generated self-signed certificate. Setting to false requires a user provided signed certificate (with PROXY_TRANSPORT_TLS_KEY and PROXY_TRANSPORT_TLS_CERT). Just set to true if you're using a reverse-proxy

Config.Name: HTTP Service Bind Address
Config.Description: The bind address of the HTTP service (within the container). Don't change this.

Config.Name: URL
Config.Description: Set to the FQDN you'll be using for owncloud. Can be an IP or a domain etc. E.g. https://owncloud.my.domain/ Otherwise owncloud will use localhost (container address).

Config.Name: Service Account ID
Config.Description: Set the Service Account ID (Required from ocis 5.0). Recommended to use a UUIDv4 string. Can just generate one online: https://www.uuidgenerator.net/version4

Config.Name: Service Account Secret
Config.Description: Set the Service Account Secret (Required from ocis 5.0). Any random long string (30+ characters) will work: https://bitwarden.com/password-generator/

Config.Name: OIDC Issuer
Config.Description: URL of your OIDC Issuer. (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)

Config.Name: OIDC Client ID
Config.Description: OIDC Client ID (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)

Config.Name: OIDC Config URL
Config.Description: OIDC Config Endpoint (/.well-known/openid-configuration) (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)

Config.Name: Rewrite OIDC config endpoint
Config.Description: Enables rewriting the /.well-known/openid-configuration to the configured OIDC issuer. Needed by the Desktop Client, Android Client and iOS Client to discover the OIDC provider. (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)

Config.Name: Token Verification Method
Config.Description: Sets how OIDC access tokens should be verified. Possible values are 'none' and 'jwt'. When using 'none', no special validation apart from using it for accessing the IPD’s userinfo endpoint will be done. When using 'jwt', it tries to parse the access token as a jwt token and verifies the signature using the keys published on the IDP’s 'jwks_uri'. Defaults to 'jwt' (REMOVE IF YOU ARE NOT USING OIDC)
